New Records: Hendricks became the first Cubs pitcher in Coors Field history to allow no more than one run and two hits in a start of at least six innings.
Key Match Events: Kyle Hendricks gave the Cubs six strong innings, allowing only one run and striking out seven.
Michael Busch hit two home runs, contributing significantly to the Cubs' 6-2 victory.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Hendricks expressed gratitude for the Cubs' continued belief in him despite his struggles earlier in the season.
Hendricks acknowledged the importance of savoring his remaining innings this season while focusing on the team's playoff push.
Manager Craig Counsell commended Hendricks for his willingness to move to the bullpen and adjust his routine, which helped him improve.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hendricks' performance helped the Cubs snap a three-game losing streak.
The Cubs are five games behind the Mets and Braves for the National League’s third Wild Card slot with 13 games left in the regular season.
